Colin Farrell in talks to join 'The Batman' as The Penguin: report
05 Nov 2019, 23:35 by Mike Flemming Jr
Warner Bros is negotiating with Colin Farrell to play The Penguin in the Matt Reeves-directed "The Batman." If the deal closes, he will round out the trio of villains going against Rob Pattinson’s Caped Crusader, with Paul Dano as The Riddler and Zoe Kravitz as Catwoman.


ANDY SERKIS EYES ALFRED PENNYWORTH ROLE IN 'THE BATMAN'


The Irish-born actor has turned in an array of performances in very different films that include Dumbo, Widows, Roman J. Israel Esq, The Lobster and Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, and has dialed up the intensity in a superhero villain role before when he menaced Ben Affleck’s Daredevil character in the showy role of Bullseye, years ago.


ANNETTE BENNING TO RECEIVE AARP MOVIES FOR GROWNUPS CAREER ACHIEVEMENT AWARD


The Penguin was played by Danny DeVito in Tim Burton’s Batman Returns in 1992.


CHANNING TATUM TO STAR AS ARMY RANGER IN ROAD-TRIP COMEDY 'DOG' & CO-DIRECT WITH REID CAROLINE – AFM


Farrell is repped by CAA.
